sen.j: 神宝（じんぽう、かむだから）とは、神社の本殿内陣に納められている物である。
sen.e: Jinpo or kamudara refers to items which are stored within the inner sanctum located in the sanctuary of a Shinto shrine
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Jinpo or kamudara refers to items which are stored within the inner sanctum located in the sanctuary of a Shinto shrine
Jinpo or kamudara refers to items which are stored within the inner sanctum located in the sanctuary of a Shinto shrine.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを追加しました。

sen.j: これらは祭神に由緒の深い宝物や調度品、装束類のことである。
sen.e: It refers to items such as treasures, furnishing goods and costumes that have a close historical association with the enshrined deity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It refers to items such as treasures, furnishing goods and costumes that have a close historical association with the enshrined deity.
It refers to items such as treasures, furnishing goods and costumes that have a close historical association with the enshrined deity.

sen.j: 広義には神社に代々伝わる宝物のことも含む。
sen.e: In a broad sense, treasures that have been passed down at the shrine through generations can be included.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In a broad sense, treasures that have been passed down at the shrine through generations can be included.
In a broad sense, treasures that have been passed down at the shrine through generations can be included.

sen.j: しかし、通常はこれらは社宝（しゃほう）と呼び、神宝とは区別する。
sen.e: However, they are normally called shaho and are distinguished from jinpo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, they are normally called shaho and are distinguished from jinpo.
However, they are normally called shaho and are distinguished from jinpo.

sen.j: 元々の神宝は、剣、玉、鏡などの呪具である。
sen.e: Originally, jinpo was a group of ritualistic tools such as swords, jewels and mirrors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処, 呪具定訳不明
sen.e: Originally, jinpo was a group of ritualistic tools such as swords, jewels and mirrors.
Originally, jinpo was a group of ritualistic tools such as swords, jewels and mirrors.

sen.j: 古代には氏族の権威の象徴、あるいは氏族の祭祀に使用されたものであった。
sen.e: In the ancient times, it symbolized the ruling clan's authority, and it was also used in religious rituals by the ruling clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In ancient times, it symbolized the ruling clan's authority, and it was also used in religious rituals by the ruling clan.
In ancient times, it symbolized the ruling clan's authority, and it was also used in religious rituals by the ruling clan.

sen.j: 『先代旧事本紀』の十種神宝などがそれに当たる。
sen.e: Examples include the ten types of jinpo in "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History).
Examples include the ten types of jinpo in "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History).
Examples include the ten types of jinpo in "Sendai Kujihongi" (Ancient Japanese History).

sen.j: 後に、神像が作られるなど神 (神道)の擬人化が進んだ。
sen.e: Later, images of deities were made, and the deities (Shintoism) became personified.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Later, images of deities were made, and the deities (Shintoism) became personified.
Later, images of gods were made, and the gods (Shinto) became personified.

sen.j: すると、神宝の中に、人間が使用するものと同じような日用品が多く含まれるようになる。
sen.e: Then, many everyday items similar to the ones used by humans were included among jinpo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then, many everyday items similar to the ones used by humans were included among jinpo.
Then, many everyday items similar to the ones used by humans were included among jinpo.

sen.j: 例えば手箱、碗、化粧用具、衣服などである。
sen.e: Examples include boxes, bowls, cosmetics and clothing.
Examples include boxes, bowls, cosmetics and clothing.
Examples include boxes, bowls, cosmetics and clothing.

sen.j: これらの神宝は、式年遷宮などの社殿更新にあわせて新調された。
sen.e: These jinpo items were replaced by the new ones at occasions such as shikinen sengu (transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in a prescribed number of years), when the shrine building was renewed.

These jinpo items were replaced by the new ones at occasions such as shikinen sengu (transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in a prescribed number of years), when the shrine building was renewed.

These jinpo items were replaced by the new ones at occasions such as shikinen sengu (transfer of a deity to a new shrine building once in a prescribed number of years), when the shrine building was renewed.

sen.j: その際、それまでの神宝は古神宝と呼ばれる。
sen.e: At such an occasion, the jinpo until then is called the old jinpo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: At such an occasion, the jinpo until then is called the old jinpo.
At such an occasion, the jinpo until then is called the old jinpo.

sen.j: その中には社宝として神社に残されるものもある。
sen.e: Some of them were kept at the shrine as shaho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some of them were kept at the shrine as shaho.
Some of them were kept at the shrine as shaho.
